Authors:
Jean Phellipe Marques do Nascimento, Sarah Jacqueline
Cavalcanti da Silva, Roberto Ramos Sobrinho, Elizabeth Ann Veasey,
Iraildes Pereira Assunção, Gaus Silvestre Andrade Lima
Title:
First Report of Dioscorea bacilliform SN virus in Yam
(Dioscorea bulbifera) in Brazil
Abstract:
Yams (Dioscorea spp.) play an important socioeconomic role
in Brazil, providing a food source and income for small and medium
farmers. Badnaviruses (family Caulimoviridae) are considered one of the
most prevalent viruses infecting yam plants. Recently, it has been shown
that endogenous Dioscorea bacilliform virus (eDBV) sequences are present
in the yam genome. In Brazil, only Dioscorea bacilliform AL virus has
been found infecting yam. Foliar samples of yam were obtained in 2014
from a Brazilian germplasm collection. Total DNA was extracted from
symptomatic leaf of the DGC-379 sample, and used as a template for PCR
amplification using degenerate primer set designed based on RT/RNaseH
coding sequences of members of the genus Badnavirus. Amplicon of the
expected size was commercially sequenced. In the present study,
Dioscorea bacilliform SN virus is reported for the first time in yam in
Brazil and in the worldwide host Dioscorea bulbifera. These results
increase concern about safe germplasm exchange among yam breeding
programs.
